question: Which country celebrates the "Meskel Festival"?
explanation: Meskel Festival, also known as the Feast of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross, is an important religious festival of the Orthodox church of Ethiopia. This festival commemorates the discovery of the "True Cross" by the Roman Emporers Saint Helena in the fourth century. This festival is mainly celebrated in Meskel Square, located in Addis Ababa, the capital city of Ethiopia, under the patronage of religious and civil leaders, on September 27/28 annually.
